And we need to do it NOW.

12/

11/

Ukraine’s political instability lingers as the US dramatically scales back its involvement in helping the nation sort through its myriad of challenges

10/ 

Terrorist groups ramp up recruitment with talk of America’s war against Muslims, including a ban on certain Muslim travel to the US

Civil war rages on in Libya as the US sends wildly confusing signals about which side it supports

9/

US/Canada relations have soured as we carry out a trade war with our most important trading partner 

Migrants flood to our southern border as we cut off funds to help Central America deal with the causes of that migration

8/

Russia’s election interference operation is kicking into higher gear, as US government sits idly (and purposely?) by doing virtually nothing 

Ebola is roaring back in Africa as America refuses to undertake the same effort it did in Africa during the last major outbreak

7/

The Northern Ireland peace process lies in jeopardy as America cheers Brexit

Saudi Arabia ratchets up its campaign of killing and torturing women and activists and journalists with impunity, including American citizens and residents

6/

Refugees continue to overwhelm our Middle Eastern allies, threatening to break countries like Jordan, as the US refuses to take refugees or pay to help shelter them

NATO is weaker than at any time in recent history because all the US does now is attack and criticize it

5/

The planet hurtles toward climate disaster faster because the US government no longer believes climate change exists or cares to do anything about it

Saudi Arabia and Qatar aren’t on speaking terms, setting off another regional power contest

4/

Israel and the Palestinians are further away from peace than ever and a two state solution seems to be disappearing forever before our eyes

Hundreds of thousands are dying from starvation, disease, and American made bombs in Yemen in the worlds worst humanitarian disaster

3/

North Korea is murdering politicians left and right under the cover of praise from the the American President 

We backed a failed government overthrow in Venezuela, making us look weak throughout Latin America and empowering Cuba and Russia

2/ 

Iran is restarting their nuclear weapons program and threatening to attack American forces in Iraq

We are in a trade war with China that is killing American farmers and consumers and there seems like no end in sight and no actual strategy to it

Morning.

2/ Arms control law allows Congress to reject a sale to a foreign country.  But Trump would claim the sale constitutes an "emergency" which means Congress can't take a vote of disapproval. It would go through automatically.

5/ Drawing a hard line on Iran in Iraq might sound good on paper, but it might end up w our troops getting kicked out of Iraq again, opening the door for ISIS. That would be much more disastrous than the inconvenience of leaving the IRGC off the list of terrorist groups.

4/ And these militias are built into the political process. They run for Parliament. Now our diplomats and military can’t talk to militia groups that have an IRGC connection, taking the U.S. out of the game on political reconciliation.

3/ Not every Shia militia in Iraq is in the IRGC’s pocket. But naming the IRGC as a terrorist group actually pushes more of them toward Iran bc if we force their hand to align w U.S. or Iran, they choose their neighbor.

2/ There is no doubt the IRGC supports terrorism in the region. They are vicious, bad actors. But when I was in Baghdad last month, our diplomatic and military leaders were almost unanimously opposed to the designation because of its practical impact on our objectives in Iraq.

1/ THREAD: The Trump Administration knew that naming the Iranian IRGC as a terrorist group would lead to increased threats against U.S. troops in Iraq. That’s why Bush and Obama didn’t do it. They concluded the benefits did not outweigh the risks.

5/ tbh if I were to design our health care system from scratch, I'd design a single payer system. I simply believe that a universal Medicare buy-in will be the most popular, most politically feasible, and quickest way to move our country toward total, universal health care.

4/ Our bill allows Medicare to negotiate directly with drug companies and plows the savings into expanding exchange tax credits for middle income Americans, making both the new Medicare plan and private insurance more affordable.

3/ If Medicare is the best insurance for Americans (which I believe it is), then consumers will choose it over private insurance. Our bill lets the market decide whether to move to a Medicare-only system, rather than making the choice for consumers by outlawing private insurance.

2/ The Choose Medicare Act would allow every American to purchase a Medicare plan. It differs from other buy-in proposals bc it would also put Medicare on the commercial market, allowing employers to offer it as part of workplace coverage.

1/ Today @SenJeffMerkley and I will reintroduce the Choose Medicare Act, the most comprehensive Medicare buy-in proposal before Congress. I believe this proposal is our best chance to unite Democrats behind a popular, bold proposal to get to universal health care. Hear me out.

Surprise -- the American people trust the party that wants to expand access to health care – not the one that wants to completely gut it.  https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2019/04/26/us/politics/ap-us-ap-poll-health-care.html …
